page.title: 15Public Office, Melchbourne
page.content: The High Sheriff of Bedfordshire for this year lives in Melchbourne.The position is one of Queen's Represntative for Law and Order in the County. The duties undertaken this year have been varied; an award in open court to a woman who had helped to lead to the arrest of four youths. The High Sheriff was also present when Prince Charles came to the County to officially open the new terminal building at Luton Airport. To become High Sheriff a person must have been involved in public works. Nominations are made by the previous High Sheriff and they are published in November. The new High Sheriff is chosen in March: this is known as 'Pricking of the Names'. The Ceremony of Oaths prior to installation can take place wherever the High Sheriff chooses.This year it was at Shire Hall
